result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operator Flee/Elude Officer-Bodily Harm or Property Damage
Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derrick D Render

records.addlTxt: signed and filed.

CASE HEARD IN BRANCH 11 FOR BRANCH 19:
Defendant Derrick D Render in court.  Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court for Derrick D Render.  Attorney Erika Strebel in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Forensic evaluation will take place the Wisconsin Forensic Unit, Room 504 of the Safety Building with Dr. Collins on 11-15-2022  at 12:00pm. Court vacated the scheduled jury trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 19.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Forwarded for signature.
CASE SPUNNED TO BRANCH 11 FOR BRANCH 19.
Received and filed: Justice Point Supervision Report.
Received and filed: State's Witness List.
Received and filed: STATE'S Requested Jury Instructions.
Received and filed: STATE'S MOTION IN LIMINE.
Conditional Release Informational Letter
Received and filed: Justice Point Supervision  Report.

Defendant Derrick D Render appeared by video.  
Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont appeared by video for Derrick D Render.  
Attorney Erika Strebel in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a scheduling Conference.  Defense request a final pretrial and jury trial dates. 
Court ordered parties to file their Pretrial documents 48 hours in advance of the final pretrial hearing.
Case remains calendared in Branch 19. Parties advised this hearing will be held in person, room 313 of the courthouse.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
ALL PREVIOUSLY ORDERED CONDITIONS OF BAIL REMAIN IN FULL EFFECT.

Defendant Derrick D Render appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court for Derrick D Render.  Attorney Erika Strebel in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a bail/bond hearing.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court modified cash bail.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference in Branch 19, Rm 313 SB.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Derrick D Render in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Derrick D Render in custody at HOC.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Derrick D Render appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer B. Stegerwald. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  
Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 19. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Bail to be heard by Judge Franke for Br. 19. Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Derrick D Render in court with Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont; both appear by video.  Defendant Derrick D Render in custody.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Garvin Guimont is newly appointed and needs time to meet with her client. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with JEZ
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Derrick D Render in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Derrick D Render in custody.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
